com.kinvey.push
Class KCSPush

java.lang.Object
  com.kinvey.push.KCSPush

public class KCSPush
extends Object

Push API used to access of push related fucntionality offered by Kinvey.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static KCSPush getInstance()
Return the single shared instance of the Push Notification Service This routine returns the shared Push Service object, creating it if required. This should be used to gain access to all push methods. Note: You must initialize KCSPush with the KCSClient instance before use

Returns:
The shared Push Service object.

linkPushIdToCurrentUser

public static void linkPushIdToCurrentUser()
Registers the Push ID for for this user/device with the Kinvey back-end. This information is associated with a particular user and therefore can be accessed from the user collection.

enablePushDeferPushIdLinking

public void enablePushDeferPushIdLinking(Application application,
                                         KinveySettings settings)
Enables PUSH messaging service. KinveySettings must contain appropriate PUSH key/secret for the selected PUSH mode (debug/production). If no mode is specified, debug will be assumed. Refer to KinveySettings for more information on appropriate property keys to use.

Parameters:
application - Application instance
settings - KinveySettings

getPushIntentReceiver

protected Class<? extends BroadcastReceiver> getPushIntentReceiver()
Returns the currently assigned intent receiver. This receiver will be called when new PUSH messages are received. This receiver should handle the following actions: ACTION_PUSH_RECEIVED ACTION_NOTIFICATION_OPENED ACTION_REGISTRATION_FINISHED

Returns:
Class of registered BroadcastReceiver

initialize

public void initialize(KCSClient client)
Initialize KCSPush with the application's KCSClient

Parameters:
client -

isInitialized

public boolean isInitialized()
Returns whether or not KCSPush has been initialized and is ready for use.

Returns:
Boolean indicating initialization status

getPushId

public String getPushId()
Return the push id stored by the library in user preferences.

Returns:
the push id

isPushEnabled

public boolean isPushEnabled()
Checks for the existence of the pushDeviceToken. Returns true is a device token has been set.

Returns:
true if push has been enabled and the device is registered, otherwise false

setIntentReceiver

public void setIntentReceiver(Class<? extends BroadcastReceiver> receiver)
Set the application receiver to be called when a new PUSH message is received. This receiver should handle the following actions: ACTION_PUSH_RECEIVED PUSH message was received ACTION_NOTIFICATION_OPENED PUSH message was opened from the notification bar ACTION_REGISTRATION_FINISHED PUSH registration has completed and application is ready to receive PUSH messages.

Parameters:
receiver -

setNotificationBuilder

public void setNotificationBuilder(KCSPushNotificationBuilder builder)
Sets the notification builder to use when constructing the Notification to display to the user in the notification bar

Parameters:
builder - KCSPushNotificationBuilder Notification builder instance
